content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.
* Reply guidelines *
1) There is a reviewer who is going to judge your thought and action for making the feasibility higher, when you receive the response from reviewer, you should re-think your thought and action according to the judgement.
2) If user providing Reviewer_thought to you, you should re-think your thought and action according to the information in Reviewer_thought.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}
Reviewer_thought: {[Optional]Your original_reply and the judgement from reviewer base on your original_reply}

Now given a task: Find the instructor of course which named Operating System through the Department of Computer Science in year 113 semester 2.  Please interact with https://cis.ncu.edu.tw/Course/main/news/announce and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** I need to find the instructor for the "Operating System" course offered by the Department of Computer Science for the year 113 semester 2. The appropriate action is likely to click on the course search link, indicated by label [5], to proceed with searching the course information.

**Action:** Click [5]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** In the screenshot, there are several course-related options available, and I need to use the appropriate course query function to search for the instructor of the "Operating System" course. Based on the textual information, the correct option to use is labeled [23], which indicates "課程查詢" (Course Inquiry). I will click this link to proceed with finding the relevant course information.

**Action:** Click [23]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The screenshot shows a menu for course inquiry options, and I'm particularly interested in finding the section to search for courses based on specific criteria. The "依照年份查詢" (Query by Year) is labeled as [51], which seems to be the right option to access the year-specific course inquiry. I need to select this option to narrow down to the year 113 and search for the "Operating System" course.

**Action:** Click [51]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The screenshot shows a table for querying courses by year, specifically for year 113 and semester indications. I need to query for the semester (上 for the first semester or 下 for the second semester) for year 113 to find the "Operating System" course. The "下" option (second semester) is located at label [13]. I will proceed by selecting this to continue with the search.

**Action:** Click [13]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** In the screenshot, it shows the course query section filtered by year 113 for the second semester. The relevant course inquiry buttons indicate specific departments or centers, and I need to locate the one that corresponds with the Department of Computer Science, which I suspect to be related to the buttons labeled [12] (學院/科系). Since I am looking for the instructor of the "Operating System" course, I would want to proceed from this point to investigate the department's specific entry.

**Action:** Click [12]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The screenshot contains various inquiry options under the "依年份查詢 - 1132" section, where I need to locate the specific department related to the "Operating System" course. The Department of Computer Science is likely represented by the entry labeled [30] (資訊學中心), and there is a corresponding query option labeled [34] to investigate further. By clicking this option, I can find the details regarding the course and its instructor.

**Action:** Click [34]
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The screenshot presents the course inquiry results for year 113 semester 2, specifically listing courses offered through the Taiwan Artificial Intelligence College Alliance. The pertinent section displays course details, including the instructor's name under the "各校教師" (Instructors). It seems necessary to scroll to see more details about the specific courses, including "Operating System," to find the instructor's information.

**Action:** Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The provided information does not show the specific course for "Operating System." Instead, it displays courses such as "AI Ethics," "Introducing Generative AI for the Humanities," and "Generative AI: Text and Image Synthesis Principles and Practice," along with their respective instructors. Since the "Operating System" course is not visible in the current listing, further action is needed to continue searching or possibly filtering based on course name. As such, I may need to scroll more to see if the course information appears below.

**Action:** Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

**Thought:** The screenshot does not display information about the "Operating System" course as initially sought. Instead, it features details for other courses, such as "Generative AI: Text and Image Synthesis Principles and Practice," "Deep Learning," and "Robotic Navigation and Exploration," along with their respective instructors. It seems I underestimated the number of entries — the "Operating System" course may be located further down or needs another filter selection. Therefore, I will scroll down to see if the course appears in the additional entries.

**Action:** Scroll [WINDOW]; down

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: "分發條件";	[1]: "課程綱要";	[2]: "10004TC5006-*";	[3]: "生成式AI：文字與圖像生成的原理與實務 Generative AI: Text and Image Synthesis Principles and Practice 本課程為AI聯盟課程，開課教師政治大學(蔡炎龍教師)
上課時間:每周二16:00-19:00
課程詳細資訊請查閱:https://sites.google.com/view/taica-ncu [不開放初選]";	[4]: "各校教師韓伯維";	[5]: "3";	[6]: "Tue89A/*-***";	[7]: "選修";	[8]: "半";	[9]: "50";	[10]: "分發條件";	[11]: "課程綱要";	[12]: "10005TC5007-*";	[13]: "深度學習 Deep Learning 本課程為AI聯盟課程，授課教師為陽明交通大學(彭文孝、陳永昇、謝秉均)教師，上課時間:每周四12:20-15:10
課程詳細資訊請查閱:https://sites.google.com/view/taica-ncu [不開放初選]";	[14]: "各校教師";	[15]: "3";	[16]: "ThuZ56/*-***";	[17]: "選修";	[18]: "半";	[19]: "20";	[20]: "分發條件";	[21]: "課程綱要";	[22]: "10006TC5008-*";	[23]: "機器導航與探索 Robotic Navigation and Exploration 本課程為AI聯盟課程，開課教師為清華大學(胡敏君教師)，上課時間:每週一晚上6:30-9:20，課程詳細資訊請查閱:https://sites.google.com/view/taica-ncu，本課程不接受停修，請謹慎評估可投入的時間再選課。 [不開放初選]";	[24]: "各校教師鍾佳儒";	[25]: "3";	[26]: "MonABC/*-***";	[27]: "選修";	[28]: "半";	[29]: "20";	[30]: "分發條件";	[31]: "課程綱要";

content:
**Thought:** The screenshot contains course listings for various subjects being offered. However, it does not display the "Operating System" course, which suggests it may not be available or might be under a different name. The courses currently visible focus on Generative AI, Deep Learning, and Robotic Navigation. I should check to see if there are any options to search for a specific course name or to filter through another course listing. There may also be scroll buttons for further navigation of the course listings.

**Action:** Scroll [WINDOW]; down
